intro: Scleranthus schroederi, commonly known as Schröder's sickleweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and typically grows in dry, rocky habitats. The plant has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of tiny, pink or purple flowers. It is characterized by its erect growth habit and is often found in open, sunny areas. Scleranthus schroederi is adapted to arid environments and has a deep root system to access water.
